oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Efficacy of Systemic and Oral Oxytetracycline for Control of a Herd Outbreak of Infectious Bovine Keratoconjunctivitis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eastman, T.
George, L.
Hird, D.
Thurmond, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: oxytetracycline formulation
parenterally administered
oral long-acting
penicillin
bovine keratoconjunctivitis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The efficacy of a combination of parenterally administered and oral long-acting oxytetracycline formulation was compared to treatment with subconjunctivally administered penicillin in controlling a herd outbreak of infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1996; 160
